sanskrit_verse:
निमेषा दश चाष्टौ च काष्ठा त्रिंशत्तु ताः कला ।
त्रिंशत्कला मुहूर्तः स्यादहोरात्रं तु तावतः ॥ १.६४॥
transliteration:
nimeṣā daśa cāṣṭau ca kāṣṭhā triṃśattu tāḥ kalā |
triṃśatkalā muhūrtaḥ syādahorātraṃ tu tāvataḥ || 1.64 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Ten nimelsa constitute one kashtha; thirty kashthas constitute one kalaa. Thirty kalas constitute one muhurta. Day and night together constitute one ahoratra.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from precise temporal structuring rooted in cosmic rhythm
Causation aligns with sequential manifestation within time units
Capacity-based responsibility arises through awareness of time-bound action

IF legal accountability hinges on time THEN compute based on nimeṣa-to-ahoratra granularity
